alert.note: Alert for Berkeley; Charleston (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 10 at 3:55PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 545 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast South Carolina, including the following counties, Berkeley, Charleston and Dorchester. * WHEN...Until 545 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Rises in small streams and normally dry arroyos. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 351 PM EDT,Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 2 and 2.5 inches of rain may fall around Shadowmoss and portions of North Charleston and northeast of the Naval Weapons Station. This rainfall is expected to cause rapid rises along Church Creek in West Ashley and the French Quarter Creek near Huger. - By 545 PM storm total rainfall amounts may range from 3 to 4 inches across the advised area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... North Charleston, Goose Creek, Hanahan, I-26/I-526 Interchange, West Ashley, Naval Weapons Station Charleston, Downtown Charleston, Daniel Island, Johns Island, Hollywood, Ravenel, Meggett, Charleston Airport, Magnolia Gardens, Don Holt Bridge, Lambs, Midland Park, Westmoreland Bridge, Park Circle and Shadowmoss.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
